revision.text:
{{Wiktionary|atmosphere}} An '''[[atmosphere]]''' is a gas layer around a celestial body.
'''Atmosphere''' may also refer to:
{{TOC right}}
==Science== * [[Atmosphere (unit)]], a unit of pressure * [[Atmosphere of Earth]] * [[Extraterrestrial atmospheres]] * [[Stellar atmosphere]]
==Arts, entertainment, and media== ===Music=== ===Groups=== * [[Atmosphere (music group)]], an American hip-hop duo from Minnesota * [[Atmosphere (Polish band)]]
===Albums=== * [[Atmosphere (Atmosphere album)|''Atmosphere'' (Atmosphere album)]] (1997) * [[Atmosphere (Eloy Fritsch album)|''Atmosphere'' (Eloy Fritsch album)]] (2003) * [[Atmosphere (Kaskade album)|''Atmosphere'' (Kaskade album)]] (2013), or the title song * [[Atmosphere (Sevenglory album)|''Atmosphere'' (Sevenglory album)]] (2007) * ''Atmosphere'', a 1969 album by Colours, produced by Dan Moore and [[Richard_Delvy#Bands_and_music|Richard Delvy]] * [[Atmospheres (album)|''Atmospheres'' (album)]] (2014)
===Songs and orchestral pieces=== * [[Atmosphere (Joy Division song)|"Atmosphere" (Joy Division song)]] (1980) * [[Atmosphere (Kaskade song)|"Atmosphere" (Kaskade song)]] (2013) * "Atmosphere" (1975), from ''[[Let's Take It to the Stage]]'' by Funkadelic * "Atmosphere" (1984), by [[Russ Abbot]] * ''[[Atmosphères]]'' (1961), an orchestral piece by György Ligeti
===Periodicals=== * [[Atmosphere (journal)|''Atmosphere'' (journal)]], an open access scientific journal * [[Atmosphere (magazine)|''Atmosphere'' (magazine)]], the inflight magazine of Air Transat
===Other uses in arts, entertainment, and media=== * [[Atmospheres (TV series)|''Atmospheres'' (TV series)]] * [[Atmospheric theatre]], a type of cinema architecture * Atmosphere, another term for a film [[Extra (acting)|extra]]
==Other uses== * [[Atmosphere (architecture and spatial design)]] * [[Atmosphere (Kolkata)]], a residential superstructure in India * [[Adobe Atmosphere]], a computer graphics platform * [[Atmosphere Visual Effects]], a Canadian company
==See also== * [[Atmosfear (disambiguation)]]
{{Disambiguation}}
